threepio.filehandling
Class FileIntake

java.lang.Object
  threepio.filehandling.FileIntake

public class FileIntake
extends java.lang.Object

FileIntake handles files for other parts of the Threepio project. It also is used to resolve files for BBF documents, as their import statements don't always match the files availalbe (missing a level of revision from the filename)

Author:
jhoule

Method Detail

fileToTrimmedString

public static java.lang.String fileToTrimmedString(java.io.File f,
                                                   java.lang.String startSnippet,
                                                   boolean model)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the part of a file starting with the startSnippet, as a string.

Parameters:
f - - the file
startSnippet - - the string to start copying into the String at.
model - - iff special "model" specific measures should be taken or not.
Returns:
the String rep of the portion of the file, empty string if not found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - when unable input the file.

canResolveFile

public static boolean canResolveFile(java.io.File f)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
For BBF documents only! returns true if a file can be resolved for the file given. this is done using resolveFile.

Parameters:
f - - the file to attempt to resolve.
Returns:
true if a a File representing the file that can be resolved, false if none can be.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - when an error occurs during the file resolve check.
See Also:
resolveFile(java.io.File)

resolveFile

public static java.io.File resolveFile(java.io.File original,
                                       boolean model)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
for BBF documents only! returns a file that is resolved for the file given. example: if the file provided is tr-098-1-0.xml, and a file with that filename is not available, the method will try to find a replacement, such as tr-098-1-0-0.xml, and return a File of it.

Parameters:
original - - the file to look for.
model - - if true, makes sure the file is of the highest "model" revision of the candidates.
Returns:
a File representing the file that can be resolved, null if none can be.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - when the file cannot be found.

resolveFile

public static java.io.File resolveFile(java.io.File original)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Finds a file or the closest match to it, based on the path of the File object passed. returns the "best" file, as a File object.

Parameters:
original - - the original file. may or may not exist.
Returns:
the best match for the file, null if none found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - file I/O reasons.

fileToString

public static java.lang.String fileToString(java.io.File f,
                                            boolean model)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
reads in a file and returns a string rep of it.

Parameters:
f - - the file to read in.
model - - if the file used should be of highest "model" revision.
Returns:
the string rep.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - - when the file cannot be resolved.
See Also:
resolveFile(java.io.File, boolean)

                                                        boolean model)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
f - - the file to read in.
model - - true if the file should be of the latest "model revision"

java.lang.Exception - - when an error occurs as the file is loaded.

currentDir

public static java.io.File currentDir()
gets the directory that the program is executed from, returning it as a File. This is required when the user creates Files with relative paths "it.xml" instead of "c:\what\it.xml." Java does not create getParentDirectory etc for relative Files.

Returns:
the directory where the program is executing from, as a File.

getRevis

private static int getRevis(java.lang.String stated,
                            java.lang.String fName)
returns an integer representation of the "model revision" for a file name.

Parameters:
stated - - the file name stated in a document
fName - - the name of the actual file.
Returns:
the revision, as an integer.

removeExt

private static java.lang.String removeExt(java.lang.String str)
removes the extension from a filename.

Parameters:
str - - the filename.
Returns:
the filename, without an extension.
